原子有符号整数API:¶

模块shared_int

class shared_atomic.atomic_int.atomic_int(value: int, mode: str = 'singleprocessing')¶

int provide atomic operations, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes

constructor to initialize the atomic_int, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes

Parameters

  • value – initial value of the int, if the initial value is longer than 8 bytes, it would fail.

  • mode – the mode in which the int will be shared. ‘singleprocessing’ or ‘s’ for single process, ‘multiprocessing’ or ‘m’ for multiprocessing, on windows platform, only singleprocessing is supported, setting it to ‘m’ or ‘multiprocessing’ will be ignored.

get() → int¶

Get the value from atomic_int, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes :return: the value

int_add_and_fetch(n: int) → int¶

increment and fetch atomically

Parameters

n – data to add

Returns

sum of the 2 values

int_and_and_fetch(n: int) → int¶

bitwise AND and fetch the result atomically

Parameters

n – data to AND

Returns

resulted value

int_compare_and_set(e: self_atomic_int, n: int) → bool¶

Compare and set atomically. This compares the contents of v with the contents of e. If equal, the operation is a read-modify-write operation that writes n into self. If they are not equal, the operation is a read and the current contents of v are written into e.

Parameters

  • e – pointer of e

  • n – value to be set

Returns

whether the contents of v and contents of e is the same

int_fetch_and_add(n: int) → int¶

increment and fetch atomically

Parameters

n – data to add

Returns

original value in v

int_fetch_and_and(n: int) → int¶

fetch then bitwise AND atomically

Parameters

n – data to AND

Returns

the result

int_fetch_and_nand(n: int) → int¶

fetch then bitwise NAND atomically

Parameters

n – data to NAND

Returns

the result

int_fetch_and_or(n: int) → int¶

fetch then bitwise OR atomically

Parameters

n – data to OR

Returns

the result

int_fetch_and_sub(n: int) → int¶

subtract and fetch atomically

Parameters

  • n – data to subtract

  • encoding – character set

Returns

original value in v

int_fetch_and_xor(n: int) → int¶

fetch then bitwise XOR atomically

Parameters

n – data to XOR

Returns

the result

int_get_and_set(n: int) → int¶

get and set atomically

Parameters

n – value to set

Returns

original value

int_nand_and_fetch(n: int) → int¶

bitwise NAND and fetch the result atomically

Parameters

n – data to NAND

Returns

resulted value

int_or_and_fetch(n: int) → int¶

bitwise XOR and fetch the result atomically

Parameters

n – data to XOR

Returns

resulted value

int_shift(n: self_atomic_int, r: self_atomic_int)¶

value exchange between 3 pointers in 2 groups atomically, store n in v after store v in r

Parameters

  • n – pointer of n

  • r – pointer of r

Returns

None

int_store(n: self_atomic_int)¶

Store value atomically

Parameters

n – the pointer from value to set

Returns

None

int_sub_and_fetch(n: int) → int¶

sub and fetch atomically

Parameters

n – data to subtract

Returns

difference of the 2 values

int_xor_and_fetch(n: int) → int¶

bitwise XOR and fetch the result atomically

Parameters

n – data to XOR

Returns

resulted value

set(value: int)¶

set the value from atomic_int, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes

property value: int¶

Get the value from atomic_int, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes :return: the value

shared_atomic.atomic_int.int_add_and_fetch(v: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, n: int) → int¶

increment and fetch atomically

Parameters

  • v – atomic_int to add to and get

  • n – data to add

Returns

sum of the 2 values

shared_atomic.atomic_int.int_and_and_fetch(v: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, n: int) → int¶

bitwise AND and fetch the result atomically

Parameters

  • v – pointer of value to AND to

  • n – data to AND

Returns

resulted value

shared_atomic.atomic_int.int_compare_and_set(v: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, e: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, n: int) → bool¶

Compare and set atomically. This compares the contents of v with the contents of e. If equal, the operation is a read-modify-write operation that writes n into self. If they are not equal, the operation is a read and the current contents of v are written into e.

Parameters

  • v – pointer of v

  • e – pointer of e

  • n – value to be set

Returns

whether the contents of v and contents of e is the same

shared_atomic.atomic_int.int_fetch_and_add(v: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, n: int) → int¶

increment and fetch atomically

Parameters

  • v – pointer of value to add to

  • n – data to add

Returns

original value in v

fetch then bitwise AND atomically

Parameters

  • v – pointer of value to AND to

  • n – data to AND

Returns

the result

fetch then bitwise NAND atomically

  • v – pointer of value to NAND to

  • n – data to NAND

  • v – pointer of value to OR to

  • n – data to OR

Returns

subtract and fetch atomically

Parameters

  • v – pointer of value to subtract from

  • n – data to subtract

  • encoding – character set

Returns

original value in v

  • v – pointer of value to XOR to

  • n – data to XOR

shared_atomic.atomic_int.int_shift(v: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, n: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, r: _cffi_backend._CDataBase)¶

value exchange between 3 pointers in 2 groups atomically, store n in v after store v in r

Parameters

  • v – pointer of v

  • n – pointer of n

  • r – pointer of r

Returns

None

shared_atomic.atomic_int.int_store(v: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, n: _cffi_backend._CDataBase)¶

Store value atomically

Parameters

  • v – the pointer to set

  • n – the pointer from value to set

Returns

None

shared_atomic.atomic_int.int_sub_and_fetch(v: _cffi_backend._CDataBase, n: int) → int¶

sub and fetch atomically

Parameters

  • v – pointer of value to subtract and get

  • n – data to subtract

Returns

difference of the 2 values

  • n – data to XOR

class shared_atomic.atomic_int.atomic_int(value: int, mode: str = 'singleprocessing')

int provide atomic operations, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes

constructor to initialize the atomic_int, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes

Parameters

  • value – initial value of the int, if the initial value is longer than 8 bytes, it would fail.

  • mode – the mode in which the int will be shared. ‘singleprocessing’ or ‘s’ for single process, ‘multiprocessing’ or ‘m’ for multiprocessing, on windows platform, only singleprocessing is supported, setting it to ‘m’ or ‘multiprocessing’ will be ignored.

Get the value from atomic_int, the int should be no longer than 8 bytes :return: the value
